item.title: [Client Side] Port = Null?
item.dc:creator: @D4rkscape D4rkscape
item.description:
@D4rkscape wrote:

put ur server name in the “” to make it connect to your server. also in the client.java, you should either change the 127.0.0.1 to your server and also look for anything labled no-ip that is not your server and change that as well. hop this helped =]]]

  • THIS IS WHAT MINE LOOKS LIKE + @note i am not advertising just helping@

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“d4rkscape2.no-ip.org”, “d4rkscape2.no-ip.org”, “d4rkscape2.no-ip.org”
});
}
}

item.title: [Client Side] Port = Null?
item.dc:creator: @1_crown_1 1 crown 1
item.description:
@1_crown_1 wrote:

Well, I Just recently jarred my client and I need help… I usually dont ask for help but I need it because i am not good with Client Side

Anyways this is what happens on my client.jar

Username :_________
Password: __________
Server: _________
Port: Null

And each time I click Log in, It says “error connecting to server”

I changed it to where it says setserver “______”“43594”
And many other things

I got a EGUI.Java file
and this is what it says inside that

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
    public static void main(String args[])
    {
                    client.main(new String[] {
                "", "", ""
            });
        }
    }

Here is a screen shot
